When a condition applies to a procedure, activity, biomedical concept, biomedical concept category, or biomedical concept surrogate then an instance must be available in the corresponding class with the specified id.

rule.Check:
(
    $idityp:=$.study.versions.**[id]{id:instanceType};
    $.study.versions.**.conditions.appliesToIds.
        {
            "parent_entity": %.%.instanceType,
            "parent_id": %.%.id,
            "id": %.id,
            "name": %.name,
            "appliesTo id": $,
            "appliesTo instanceType": $ in $keys($idityp) ? $lookup($idityp,$) : "[Invalid id]",
            "dataset": %.instanceType
        }
        [
            $not(`appliesTo instanceType` in
                [
                    'Procedure',
                    'Activity',
                    'BiomedicalConcept',
                    'BiomedicalConceptCategory',
                    'BiomedicalConceptSurrogate'
                ]
            )
        ]
)
rule.Description: When a condition applies to a procedure, activity, biomedical concept, biomedical concept category, or biomedical concept surrogate then an instance must be available in the corresponding class with the specified id.

Outcome.Message: An invalid id value has been specified to indicate what the condition applies to - either the specified id is not an id for anything, or the instance identified by the id is not a procedure, activity, biomedical concept, biomedical concept category, or biomedical concept surrogate.
